description.narrative:
The objectives of the intervention:
Hromadske's new management elected in summer 2021 has clarified the project objectives, aligning them closer with the Sida agreement conditionalities. Also, new Outcome 5 was added at the end of Year 3. As of November 2021, the five project outcomes are as follows:
Outcome 1: Hromadske TV has improved its governance model and launched a lean organisational structure.
Outcome 2: Hromadske TV's Strategy pillars as to developing its website, increasing audience outreach and audience engagement online have been successfully implemented (2019-2021 Strategy, and year 1 of the Strategy for 2022-2024).
Outcome 3: Hromadske TV has increased its capacity to produce quality content.
Outcome 4: Hromadske has strengthened its sustainability via building up core media management competencies and diversifying revenue streams.
Outcome 5: Hromadske has transformed into agile, mid-size media outlet (of about 50 staff members) by the end of 2022.
The Embassy assesses that the cooperation partner has sufficient capacity to achieve the planned objectives at this stage. The Embassy also welcomes the realistic approach taken on by new Hromadske management as to downsizing the team in 2022, making the organization more agile and viable. During Years 1 and 2 of the project Hromadske has proven its ability to achieve results in the constrained circumstances. Quality content continued to be successfully produced for big online audience in an uninterrupted fashion despite radical international transformations in the organization and limitations caused by Covid-19 pandemic.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.

title.narrative: Decision on Amendment 2 of Contribution "Hromadske TV 2019-2022/Phasing out"

description.narrative:
November 2021 update:
Project implementation during 2019-2021 has been progressing well and in line with the objectives, already exceeding the expected interim results by a number of indicators. The cooperation partner has managed to achieve noticeable results in a challenging political and economic context.
1) Main achievements to date: Hromadske TV as a media outlet has reached 9 million monthly audience online, with 5 mln via its website and 4 mln via social media. It became the 6th most quoted media in Ukraine, according to Vox Ukraine, and ranked 2nd for adherence to journalistic standards. According to different media consumption studies during Years 1 and 2 of this project, Hromadske TV has confidently stayed among top 8 Ukrainian media in terms of quality and professional standards, as well as audience share. It is important to note that online and social media have been the leading sources of news consumption for Ukrainians since 2019, therefore the Embassy assesses that Hromadske is on the right track in terms of impact.
2) In 2020-2021 the organization has undergone major internal reorganization with focus on enhancing distribution and non-donor revenues. At the end of Year 2 non-donor revenues reached 10%, which is a commendable progress in the current Ukrainian market realia for online media. Diversification of revenue streams has significantly improved, so Sida's investment into knowledge coupled with necessary hardware has started to yield good results. The Embassy welcomes Hromadske's ambition and rigorous efforts to further increase non-donor revenues target in Year 3 up to 18%.
3) The transformation of the governance model of Hromadske was completed during Year 2. This was a key requirement/conditionality set by Sida for this project. The previous organizational structure had an in-built conflict of interests continuously blocking the organization's decision-making and healthy development, which was also documented in Danida mid-term review of support to Hromadske. During Years 1 and 2 Hromadske managed to minimize conflict of interests and established a lean organizational structure, which was further approved by the General Assembly of the NGO. Hromadske's Charter was formally changed in Year 2 to reflect the new structure. New Supervisory Board and management were elected at the final stage of the transformation, by summer 2021. The Embassy assesses that the work on the new governance model was completed with maximum possible results under the current circumstances.
It is worth noting, however, that the cooperation partner went through three changes of management since 2019. Because of this management turbulence, long-term fundraising was somehow sidelined, which resulted in 72% budget deficit for 2022. The cost extension for Year 3 aims to help Hromadske's new management to complete the transformation and stabilize the organization's new course throughout 2022.
4) Narrative and financial reporting for Year 2 has been of satisfying quality, audit report for 2020 has been unqualified and without major observations/recommendations. The narrative report was well structured, with due focus on the outcome level, sufficient evidence and detail. The Embassy communicated recommendations on further improvements of the report structure to Hromadske.
5) The cooperation partner's capacity to implement multi-year Strategy: The Embassy assesses that it is commendable for Hromadske's new management to treat the 2019-2021 Strategy as a moving target, striving to revise it and make it a more realistic document. The current Strategy went though annual revision and adjustments during the reporting period. The most important change during Year 2 regards distribution platforms: Hromadske abandoned cable and satellite, making its website a priority platform. Change of social media algorithms was also identified as a vulnerability. As to new niches and possibilities for growth, Hromadske added TikTok to its platforms and quickly became a leader in this segment among news media in Ukraine, and in made it to top-20 in Europe. The Embassy assesses that the cooperation partner has an adequate ability to learn and adjust its Strategy stemming from context changes. By the end of Year 2, the new management started stakeholder consultations on the development of the new Strategy for 2022-2024, which is commendable and confirms Hromadske's strong focus on long-term strategic planning.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
